eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: The Yale Spizzwinks(?)
eventData.description: We are the world’s oldest underclassmen a cappella group. Hangout with the Spizzwinks(?) and learn more about how to get involved in a cappella!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Undergrad Chapter of iCure Health
eventData.description:
Yale Undergraduate Chapter of iCure Health is part of a global non-profit that provides general education on preventive medicine as a means to combat chronic diseases, such as heart disease, diabetes, and cancer.

Are you interested in prevention of disease? Come learn more about iCure Health and the current projects we are working on! We will have trivia about prevention and other fun activities.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Climbing Team
eventData.description:
The Yale Climbing Team climbs weekly at a local New Haven climbing gym. Additionally, we host social events and occasionally members of the team climb outdoors!

Come join the Yale Climbing Team for a "knotty" evening! Grab a shoelace or piece of rope and learn 4 knots (1 for climbing and 3 for everyday use) to conquer the challenges of campus life!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Undergraduate Quantum Computing
eventData.description:
The Yale undergraduate Quantum Computing (YuQC) group is a network of peers working to better understand and leverage principles of Quantum Computation. Yale has notably driven innovation at the frontiers of quantum information science for the past few decades. Our student organization was thus formed out of a necessity to bridge the gap between Yale’s vibrant graduate research community in quantum engineering and the potential quantum scientists in its undergraduate student body.

YuQC is fundamentally an organization that brings together students in the pursuit of knowledge and interdisciplinary innovation. To accomplish the breadth of our goals, we are thus committed to fostering an inclusive environment that best supports the diversity of our talented membership.

Come join our Yale undergraduate Quantum Computing Group Social. Learn more at yaleqc.com and qchack.io.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Redhot & Blue
eventData.description:
Welcome! We're Redhot & Blue, Yale's jazziest, snazziest, pizzazziest (not to mention ~hottiest~) a cappella group!

Redhot is Yale's oldest all-gender a cappella group. Since 1977, we have brought our award-winning sound to incredible places all over the world, including Brazil, France, and China. Redhot's distinctive repertoire, sophisticated sound, and engaging soloists set us apart from other groups in terms of musicianship and performance - singing everything from jazz standards to Broadway hits to Beatles favorites!

Join Redhot for a virtual a cappella concert! We will be presenting some of the music videos we have produced over the past year. Afterwards, you're welcomed to stay for more interactive activities and chat with us.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Christian Union Lux
eventData.description:
Christian Union Lux is a Christian fellowship and undergraduate organization at Yale University. CU Lux’s shared mission is to transform our nation and world by developing and connecting bold Christian leaders. We provide an in-depth study of Scripture, Christian leadership training, mentoring, fellowship, and support for Christian students. We also provide resources and opportunities to help any interested students — whatever their spiritual background or beliefs — learn more about Christianity. Our main activities include Bible courses, a bi-weekly lecture series called “Rooted,” retreats, and various on-campus outreaches.

COME JOIN THE CHRISTIAN UNION CAROUSEL, APRIL 9TH, 8:00-10:00 PM EST! Drop into this Zoom and loop through different breakout rooms to learn about who we are as an organization, meet our student team, and socialize with the CU community!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Effective Altruism
eventData.description:
At Yale Effective Altruism, our mission is to answer one question: how can we do the most good with our resources? We are driven to solve the largest problems that humanity faces today—whether it be global health, extreme poverty, animal welfare, engineered pandemics, AI Risk, nuclear security, climate change, or other existential and global catastrophic risks—through research, public policy, ethics, charity entrepreneurship, philanthropy, direct work, and the many other resources, opportunities and privileges at our disposal.

In joining us, you won’t just enjoy deep and lasting conversations, but a global community stretching across all disciplines, such as philosophy, psychology, political science, computer science, history, economics, and more, working together to identify and solve the most impactful cause areas of today.

We host speaker events, dinners with prominent professors, weekly discussion groups, and an immersive ‘Fellowship Program’, which is aimed at helping our members build their plans for how they will help improve the world.

If any of the above interests you, consider stopping by!

WELCOME TO YALE! We’re interested in helping you find summer opportunities and join the Yale Effective Altruism community. Come to learn about our summer fellowship program, open this summer to all prefrosh!

Read more about our fellowship program here: https://www.yaleea.com/fellowship
Schedule for 1 on 1’s with YEA members here: https://airtable.com/shrOLV2b11wq48gd0

eventData.headline: The Good Show
eventData.description:
The Good Show is Yale's premier late-night style sketch comedy group! We write all original content for every show, and have been producing virtual shows since the pandemic started. Check us out on YouTube at "The Good Show Yale!"

Come hang out with the Good Show to learn about sketch comedy on campus, write a few jokes, and maybe even meet Marvin Chun*!
*missing context: independent fact-checkers say information in this statement could mislead people.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Thomastic Institute at Yale
eventData.description:
The Thomistic Institute exists to promote Catholic truth in our contemporary world by strengthening the intellectual formation of Christians at universities, in the Church, and in the wider public square. The thought of St. Thomas Aquinas, the Universal Doctor of the Church, is our touchstone.

The Thomistic Institute is part of the Pontifical Faculty of the Immaculate Conception at the Dominican House of Studies in Washington, DC.  Join us for a  Zoom Q&A!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Precision Marching Band
eventData.description:
The YPMB is Yale's premier "marching" band, and we invite all students (and even faculty) to join us!  

Do you play an instrument? Great! Show off your skills while playing alongside YPMB members who are also in other groups, like the Yale Concert Band and the Symphony Orchestra. Always wanted to learn how to play one? Awesome! We can hook you up with an instrument and a teacher. Love appreciating music, but not playing it? Incredible! All of our music is student arranged (that's right-we get to play all the pop, rock, hip-hop, etc. music we want!)! Love the vibe of the band, but looking for a virtual art outlet? Join the Squids, who put together all of our props for halftime shows (re: our 40ft bald eagle prop). Got a good sense of humor? Help write and put together our halftime shows-every member of the band has input!

We could go on for pages trying to tell you what we are. You’d be best off to show up and find out, really. You won’t be disappointed!

Join the Yale Precision Marching Band's Head Student Arrangers to learn how every song we play is arranged by our members! They will be teaching people tricks, tips, and advice for how to turn your favorite songs into future YPMB classics, and answering any and all questions about the arranging process.
